question: Which place in the world is known as 'Battle Field of Europe'?
hints: Between the 16th and early 19th centuries, It served as the battleground between many European powers
It is bordered by the Netherlands to the north, Germany to the east
aboutAnswer:
From the end of the Middle Ages until the 17th century, the area of Belgium was a prosperous and cosmopolitan centre of commerce and culture. Between the 16th and early 19th centuries, Belgium served as the battleground between many European powers.
That's why Belgium is called the "Battlefield of Europe", a reputation strengthened by both world wars. The country emerged in 1830 following the Belgian Revolution when it seceded from the Netherlands.
